sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph:

```
A -- 1 -- B -- 2 -- C
|         |         |
3         4         5
|         |         |
D -- 6 -- E -- 7 -- F
```

What is the Hamiltonian cycle in the above graph?
message_2:
A Hamiltonian cycle is a closed loop on a graph where every node (vertex) is visited exactly once. In the given graph, one possible Hamiltonian cycle is:

A → B → C → F → E → D → A

The cycle can also be traversed in the reverse direction:

A → D → E → F → C → B → A

Note that there might be other Hamiltonian cycles in the graph as well.
